content.description: Stand start with your pick of crimps and sidepulls about five feet off the deck.  From there, work straight up the slab using an array of holds, then make a tricky reach to the lip (crux) and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads, but the landing is very good.
content.location: It is located just to the right of the southwest-facing arete.

content.description:
Chilly Willy climbs an interesting scoop on mixed quality rock over a poor landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the flake (soundness is questionable, but it took my abuse) and a heel far out left.  From there, make a big move to the large shelf, then move up to the incut crimps at the crack (crux), continue following the crack to the right, campus to the jugs at the corner, and top it out.

Getting both hands to the crack felt like the crux for me, as the feet are thin and it requires a fair amount of balance.
content.protection: Bring a bunch of pads, and a spotter wouldn't hurt.  It is not the best landing, as it is sloping, and several rocks surround the problem.
content.location: This ascends the southeast corner of Seeslant.
